intro: Brassica pachypoda, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, elongated leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, containing several seeds that are dispersed by wind. Brassica pachypoda is often found in disturbed soils and can be a weed in agricultural settings.
